paper_abstract: We draw on the observation that the amount of heat diffusing outside of a heated body in a short period of time is proportional to its surface area, to design a simple algorithm for approximating the surface area of a convex body given by a membership oracle. Our method has a complexity of O-*(n(4)), where n is the dimension, compared to O-*(n(8)) for the previous best algorithm. We show that our complexity cannot be improved given the current state-of-the-art in volume estimation. (c) 2013 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 43, 407-428, 2013
paper_title: Heat Flow and A Faster Algorithm to Compute the Surface Area of A Convex Body
